title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
The U.S. food system is under renewed strain as Covid-19's Omicron variant stretches workforces from processing plants to grocery stores, leaving gaps on supermarket shelves.

---

Stringent rules to try to keep Hong Kong free of Covid-19 are driving away more foreign executives, chipping away at the city's decades-old status as one of the world's top business hubs.

---

Activist investor Blackwells has a significant stake of less than 5% in Peloton and is preparing to push the company's board to fire CEO Foley and pursue a sale.

---

Trian, the activist hedge fund run by Nelson Peltz, has acquired a stake in Unilever, adding pressure to the packaged-food and consumer-goods giant after its failed $68 billion bid for Glaxo's consumer-health business.

---

Shifts within the bond market are removing a key pillar of support for Wall Street's more speculative bets, dragging down major stock indexes as investors flee everything from tech stocks to cryptocurrencies.

---

Microsoft, Apple and Tesla are among companies headlining a busy earnings week that comes as investors look for reassurance after the Nasdaq notched a 12% decline to start the year.
